alert.note: Alert for Jim Hogg; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 4:22AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Jim Hogg, northwestern Starr and southeastern Zapata Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 422 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Falcon, or near Lopeno, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Viboras, Lopeno, New Falcon and Guerra. This includes US Highway 83 between mile markers 782 and 792. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
